page.title: 04Chew Magna Mill
page.content: The huge wood and cast iron wheel goes around if the sluice gates of the mill leat are opened.Its diameter is about 6 metres and has some of the paddles missing.The wheel,considered to be Victorian, ceased productive work in grinding animal feed and flour in 1945.Between 1945 and 1961 the wheel was used to drive the hoist but now all the parts are worked electrically. The mill looks to be a rickety old building three storeys high in which there are still cogs and old hoists.The top room was used for storing grain to feed the hopper. Marks on the wall indicate that some rooms were only 5-6 feet high, suggesting that people didn't often go in there. Nowadays the wheel hardly ever works and the mill is used as a warehouse by the West Midland Farmers.
